scene_info: The Olympic flame arrived on French soil at the southern port city of Marseille amid tight security, 79 days before the opening ceremony of the Paris Games.

role_info: The center in the image is Tyla, a singer.
scene_info: Actors, musicians and tycoons were among those dressing to impress at the Metropolitan Museum of Art fundraiser in New York City. For her first ever Met Gala, singer Tyla enlisted Balmain for a dress made of sand - a reference to the sands of time theme. Her movement was so restricted she had to ask for help to climb the stairs.

role_info: From left to right are Plato and Aristotle.
scene_info: Plato and Aristotle in Raphael's 1509 fresco, The School of Athens. Aristotle holds his Nicomachean Ethics and gestures to the earth, representing his view in immanent realism, whilst Plato gestures to the heavens, indicating his Theory of Forms, and holds his Timaeus.

place_info: Florence Cathedral in Florence, Tuscany, Italy
Rumbeke Castle in Rumbeke in West Flanders, Belgium
the Piazza della Signoria (Signoria Square), in front of the Palazzo Vecchio, Florence, Italy
scene_info: The Fountain of Neptune was designed by Baccio Bandinelli, but created by Bartolomeo Ammannati with the assistance of several other artists between 1560 and 1574.
David is a masterpiece of Italian Renaissance sculpture, created from 1501 to 1504 by Michelangelo.
The Mona Lisa is a half-length portrait painting by Italian artist Leonardo da Vinci.

place_info: the refectory of the Convent of Santa Maria delle Grazie in Milan, Italy
scene_info: The Last Supper is a mural painting by Leonardo da Vinci, dated to c. 1495–1498.

Designed principally by Donato Bramante, Michelangelo, and Carlo Maderno, with piazza and fittings by Gian Lorenzo Bernini, the Papal Basilica of Saint Peter in the Vatican is one of the most renowned works of Italian Renaissance architecture and is the largest church in the world by interior measure.
Hamlet, Horatio, Marcellus, and the Ghost of Hamlet's Father. Created by Henry Fuseli, 1780-1785.
Oberon, Titania and Puck with Fairies Dancing. Created by William Blake, c. 1786.
Copernicus's birthplace (ul. Kopernika 15, left). Together with no. 17 (right), it forms Muzeum Mikołaja Kopernika.

place_info: A rugby field in the South African city of Cape Town
scene_info: Muslim volunteers prepare to feed more than 90,000 people for Eid...
Thousands of people witnessed a celestial spectacle that plunged parts of North America into momentary darkness. Mazatlan in Mexico was the first to experience totality.
Winds from the Arctic brought cold weather to the UK. Here, snow falls on the Beatles Statue.

A tourist poses in front of snow-covered trees, known as snow monsters. The area is one of the few places where the right combination of snow, strong winds and low temperatures trap trees in layers of snow and ice, forming unique shapes.

place_info: the Pyramids of Teotihuacan in Mexico
scene_info: Hot air balloons take off at dawn.

place_info: an urban forest in Nairobi, Kenya
scene_info: A group of girls react as they gather to plant tree seedlings during a nationwide tree planting public holiday.

place_info: Nasa's Kennedy Space Center in Florida
scene_info: A SpaceX Falcon-Heavy rocket with the Psyche spacecraft on board is launched. The craft is heading to a metal world - an asteroid called 16 Psyche - which telescopic observations suggest is made from up to 60% iron and nickel.

role_info: Lance Stroll
scene_info: Canadian Lance Stroll, of the Aston Martin F1 team, climbs out of his car after crashing during qualifying ahead of the Singapore Grand Prix.

role_info: From left to right are Oihane Hernandez and Claudia Zornoza.
scene_info: Spain's Oihane Hernandez and Claudia Zornoza celebrate after beating England in the World Cup final.
People watch a wildfire raging in a forest. For five days, fires have burned near the city and west along the coast.

role_info: From left to right are Tracy Dyson and Marina Vasilevskaya.
scene_info: Nasa astronaut Tracy Dyson and Spaceflight participant Marina Vasilevskaya, from Belarus, are seen during their spacesuit check, shortly before launch to the International Space Station (ISS).

place_info: Longli county, Guizhou Province of China
scene_info: Members of the Miao community perform the Tiaodong, which means dance in a cave, at the Tiaodong Festival.

role_info: Taylor Swift
scene_info: Taylor Swift stole the show at the Grammy Awards, becoming the first performer to win Album Of The Year four times. She had previously been tied on three, with Stevie Wonder, Paul Simon and Frank Sinatra.
A flock of sheep cross an old bridge which was revealed by the low waters of the Guadalteba reservoir during a period of drought.

role_info: Maya Gabeira
scene_info: Brazilian big wave surfer Maya Gabeira rides a wave in Praia do Norte, Nazare, Portugal.

place_info: the 1,000-year-old Norman Tower of St Albans Cathedral in Hertfordshire, England
scene_info: People practice yoga. The art installation is entitled Peace Doves and was created by Peter Walker.
Revellers turned out in large numbers to celebrate the new year in Australia as fireworks lit up the sky over the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Sydney Opera House.

place_info: a coastal area near São Paulo, Brazil
scene_info: More than 750 people lost their homes and more than 40 died in landslides after record rainfall. All but one of the deaths were in São Sebastião, 80km (50 miles) north of Bertioga.
Fans flooded the streets, singing, dancing and hugging one another, after the city's team won their first Serie A football title in 33 years.

Young dancers compete during the Inveraray Highland Games in Scotland. The games are held annually in the grounds of Inveraray Castle and celebrate Scottish culture and heritage with field and track events, piping and highland dancing competitions.
Children react during a daytime screening at an outdoor cinema.

role_info: Eleanor Smart
